from hetdesrun.component.registration import register
# add your own imports here

import pandas as pd

# ***** DO NOT EDIT LINES BELOW *****
# These lines may be overwritten if component details or inputs/outputs change.
COMPONENT_INFO = {
    "inputs": {
        "data": {"data_type": "ANY"},
        "trained_model": {"data_type": "ANY"},
    },
    "outputs": {
        "predictions": {"data_type": "ANY"},
    },
    "name": "Predict Sklearn Trained Model",
    "category": "Models",
    "description": "Predict Sklearn Trained Model",
    "version_tag": "1.0.0",
    "id": "41e8bf16-0a16-6021-33c9-88c2f8336df8",
    "revision_group_id": "41e8bf16-0a16-6021-33c9-88c2f8336df8",
    "state": "RELEASED",
    "released_timestamp": "2022-02-09T17:33:32.826915+00:00",
}

from hdutils import parse_default_value  # noqa: E402, F401


def main(*, data, trained_model):
    # entrypoint function for this component
    # ***** DO NOT EDIT LINES ABOVE *****
    # write your function code here.

    return {"predictions": pd.DataFrame(trained_model.predict(data), index=data.index)}
documentation:
# Predict Sklearn Trained Model

## Description
Predict Sklearn Trained Model.

## Inputs
* **data** (Pandas Series or Pandas DataFrame): The data on which the model is applied.
* **trained_model** (Any): The trained sklearn model.

## Outputs
* **predictions** (Pandas Series or Pandas DataFrame): The predicted values.

## Details
Calls the predict method of the trained model on new data.
name: Predict Sklearn Trained Model
